required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of TACE on Downstaging Hepatocellular Carcinoma Beyond UCSF Criteria;
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of TACE on Downstaging Hepatocellular Carcinoma Beyond UCSF Criteria: a Multi-center, Randomized, Parallel-controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter, randomized, parallel controlled study to determine the efficacy and safety of transcatheter arterial chemoembolization (TACE) on downstaging hepatocellular carcinoma beyond University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) criteria.

primary_outcome.description: Criteria for success rate in downstaging meet UCSF criteria or the standard for liver resection.

secondary_outcome.description: Disappearance of any intratumoral arterial enhancement in all target lesions
At least a 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of viable (enhancement in the arterial phase) target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum of the diameters of target lesions
Number of the subjects that do not qualify for partial response or progressive disease measured by modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors( mRECIST) criteria

An increase of at least 20% in the sum of the diameters of viable (enhancing) target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum of the diameters of viable (enhancing) target lesions recorded since treatment started
Interval between initial TACE treatment and the success or failure of downstaging according to the UCSF criteria assessed by the dynamic enhanced CT ;

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 7 days before TACE or curative treatments to the endpoints of the trial.(Up to 36 months)
secondary_outcome.description: AFP and PIVKA-II must be measured at 1week before, 1 week,1month after TACE or curative treatment; AFP ,PIVKA-II could be measured every 3-6 months during follow up according to the availability of equipment at the site

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the date of the first TACE to the end of the clinical trial or the death of the patient，Up to 36months
secondary_outcome.description: Changes of the Child-pugh Score that used to assess the prognosis of chronic liver disease,consisting of 5 items(ascites,total bilirubin，albumin,prothrombin time and degree of encephalopathy),of which is scored 1-3 points,with 3 indicating greatest severity)
as the time from surgery initiation to tumor recurrence or death from any cause
as the time from surgery initiation to disease progression or death from any cause
as the time from surgery initiation to death from any cause
